jrtr.gldeferredrenderer

Class GLBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • jrtr.gldeferredrenderer.GLBuffer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FrameBuffer, GBuffer

    public abstract class GLBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple class for creating, reading, and writing to an OpenGL framebuffer object (FBO). FBOs are the key OpenGL data structures for writing (rendering) and reading from off-screen images and textures.
    Author:
    Heinrich Reich

    • Constructor Detail

      • GLBuffer

        public GLBuffer(com.jogamp.opengl.GL3 gl,
                int width,
                int height,
                int renderTargets,
                boolean useDepthBuffer,
                int format)
        Creates a new OpenGL framebuffer object (FBO).
        Parameters:
        gl - the OpenGL context
        width - the width of the textures
        height - the height of the texture
        renderTargets - number of textures/render targets
        useDepthBuffer - whether to use a depth buffer
        format - the format

      • GLBuffer

                int renderTargets,
                boolean useDepthBuffer)
        Creates a new OpenGL framebuffer object (FBO) with a default GL3.GL_RGB8 format.
        Parameters:
        gl -
        width -
        height -
        renderTargets -
        useDepthBuffer -

    • Method Detail

      • init

        private void init()
        Initialize the OpenGL framebuffer object (FBO). First we generate a framebuffer object and bind it as the current buffer. Then we create as many textures as specified in GLBuffer(com.jogamp.opengl.GL3, int, int, int, boolean). If needed, we also create a depth buffer for the render target. Later (after we rendered into the FBO), we can read from these textures via the usual OpenGL functionality. The abstract method handleCreationError(boolean) gets called here.

      • resize

        public void resize(int width,
                   int height)
        Resizes the frame buffer, i.e. destroys the buffer and its textures, and re-initializes the buffer with the new dimensions.
        Parameters:
        width -
        height -

      • handleCreationError

        protected abstract void handleCreationError(boolean failed)
        Gets called after the initialization.
        Parameters:
        failed - true if an error occurred during initialization step.

      • beginWrite

        public void beginWrite()
        Binds ("activate") this FBO, so any rendering calls will draw into this FBO. Use endWrite() when you are finished with writing.

      • endWrite

        public void endWrite()
        Unbinds this framebuffer, i.e. binds the previous buffer again. Only use this method if you called beginWrite() before.

      • beginRead

        public void beginRead(int i)
        Begins reading from a texture from this FBO by binding ("activating") it. Use endRead() if you are done with reading.
        Parameters:
        i - the id of the wished texture.

      • endRead

        public void endRead()
        Ends reading from this buffer. Only use this method if you called beginRead(int) before.

      • createDepthBuffer

        private void createDepthBuffer()
        Does all OpenGL calls for creating a depth buffer for this buffer.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes this buffer and its textures, i.e. releases all memory.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns:
        the current set width.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns:
        the current set height.

      • getTexture

        public int getTexture(int index)
        Parameters:
        index -
        Returns:
        the internal texture index in OpenGL, need for passing textures to a shader.
